Job Title: Senior Integration Architect - Oracle Health/Cerner

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Consulting, Information Technology

Description:
Support the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Electronic Health Record Modernization (EHRM) program in the capacity of a Senior Integration Architect, leveraging Cerner expertise to manage strategic projects within VHA and Oracle Health.
Key technical experience:5 years of hands-on experience with Oracle/Cerner systems, either within client sites or relevant professional environments.Active member or Alum of the Tiger Institute is highly desirable, along with a demonstrated breadth of knowledge in cross-functional solutions within the healthcare domain.
Key duties:Manage strategic projects in VHA, and Oracle Health, aligning clinical and technical expertise. Ensure optimal outcomes for EHR strategy by identifying and addressing gaps that may affect program success. Advise on, develop, and implement best practices, policies, and EHR design and workflows.Develop processes to integrate technical solutions and mitigate program risks. Lead an integration architect team, employing program management methodology to ensure timely delivery without compromising quality.
Required Experience:At least 5 years of professional work experience.Evaluates the information and knowledge requirements of healthcare professionals and patients, analyzes and improves clinical procedures, designs and integrates clinical decision support systems, and takes a leading role in the acquisition, customization, development, implementation, and enhancement of clinical information systems like EHRs and order-entry systems, focusing on ongoing evaluation and refinement.Supervise and create new approaches and solutions.A Master’s Degree or PhD in Healthcare or a related scientific, technical, or clinical field is necessary. Alternatively, an additional 12 years of pertinent experience can be used in place of a degree.
Experience Preferred:Experience implementing Electronic Health RecordsExperience with the Department of Veteran's Affairs, Department of Defense (DoD)Experience with Oracle/Cerner
Elentic prides itself on being a risk-focused company and as such, key success criteria are being able to identify and mitigate risks. We believe that this is best accomplished through transparent and open and honest communication. Therefore, a successful candidate will be a strong team player and able to communicate effectively across a multidisciplinary team (e.g. electronic health care SMEs, IT operation engineering SMEs, and business/project analysts).Elentic provides equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals. Employment decisions at Elentic will be based on performance, qualifications, abilities, education, and experience. Elentic does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Elentic complies with any applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
